Elementary:
“It is good to test ideas, even if they don’t
get funding, because that way you save a
lot of time finding out it wasn’t a good idea
and you can get smarter faster,” she says.
Intermediate:
For Danae Ringelmann, co-founder of
Indiegogo, the “gravity light” is a perfect
example of how meritocratic crowdfunding can
be and how it can test an entrepreneur’s idea.
“It is the first time that getting money has been
fast, efficient and meritocratic, because it is
not about ‘How do I get access to the decision
makers in that bank?’ or ‘Who do I know in
that venture capital company?’ This is all about
proving your worth to your customers and fans,
getting them to agree your idea will work and
fund it.
